title: $150 billion+ a year of capital flowing out China: China’s reopening drives more of the wealthy out
description:
#chinainsights 
In a recent similar incident, on January 5 of this year, a photo was posted of a renowned Chinese actor, Tang Guoqiang. He attended a party in the United States. The actor, born in 1952, has a long list of credits, including playing the former Communist Party leader Mao Zedong in "The Long March," a role he has played many times since.
In the midst of an epidemic outbreak in China, Mr. and Mrs. Tang appeared in the United States, which led to a lot of controversies. One netizen wrote, "Old Mao is also in the United States, so now it's really 'Mao Runzhi'. Another name for Mao Zedong is Mao Runzhi. Runxue, or runology, or run philosophy is an internet buzzword in mainland China that refers to the study of how to leave China and emigrate to developed countries. So when faced with the flight of Mao's character, Chinese netizens lamented, "The rich can make a profit, but we proletarians can only rise up and make a revolution.

Have questions? Do you have something to share with us about China? We want to hear from you!
